returns.value: The resolved address, or zero if unset

params._registry: DotNS registry used for ownership checks

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.value: The address to associate with the node

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

addressOf(bytes32).notice: Returns the resolved address for a node

registry().notice: Registry used to resolve node ownership

setAddress(bytes32,address).notice: Sets the resolved address for a node

documentation.text: @notice Registry used to resolve node ownership
@dev Reserved storage space to allow for layout changes in the future.

@notice Restricts access to the owner of `node` as recorded in the registry
 @param node Node identifier

@notice Initializes the resolver
 @param _registry DotNS registry used for ownership checks

@notice Internal ownership check for a registry node
 @param node Node identifier

@notice Returns implementation version
 @return versionString Current version string
